summary: Mont Blanc is the tallest mountain in the Alps and Western Europe, standing at 4,805.59 meters (15,766 feet). It's located on the border between France and Italy. This massive mountain is great for outdoor fun like hiking, climbing, and skiing. Many people climb it using the Go√ªter Route, which takes two days. The nearby towns of Courmayeur in Italy and Saint-Gervais-les-Bains and Chamonix in France are popular with visitors. There's even a cable car that goes over the mountain, and a long tunnel underneath for cars to drive through.
title: Mont Blanc
